sen.j: 正親町三条実有（おおぎまちさんじょう さねよし、天正16年（1588年）‐寛永10年7月13日 (旧暦)（1633年8月17日））は、安土桃山時代後期から江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Saneyoshi OGIMACHISANJO (1588 - August 17, 1633) was a Kugyo (a top court official) over the late Azuchi-momoyama to the early period of the Edo period.
Saneyoshi OGIMACHISANJO (1588 - August 17, 1633) was a Kugyo (a top court official) from the late Azuchi-momoyama to the early Edo period.
Saneyoshi OGIMACHISANJO (1588 - August 17, 1633) was a Kugyo (a top court official) from the late Azuchi-Momoyama to the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 後陽成天皇（107代）・後水尾天皇（108代）・明正天皇（109代）の三帝にわたり仕えた廷臣で官位は正二位権大納言まで昇った。
sen.e: He was a retainer of Imperial Court who served three generations: Emperor Goyosei (107th), Emperor Gomizunoo (108th), and Empress Meisho, and his highest official court rank was Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Major Counselor).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served three generations: Emperor Goyosei (107th), Emperor Gomizunoo (108th), and Empress Meisho, and his highest official court rank was Shonii Dainagon (Senior 2nd Rank, Major Counselor).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served three generations: Emperor Goyozei (107th), Emperor Gomizunoo (108th), and Empress Meisho (109th), and his highest official court rank was Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 父は権中納言正親町三条公仲。
sen.e: His father was Chunagon (middle counsellor) Kiminaka OGIMACHISANJO.
His father was Chunagon (middle counsellor) Kiminaka OGIMACHISANJO.
His father was Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) Kiminaka OGIMACHISANJO.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 母は権大納言勧修寺晴右の娘。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Dainagon (Major Counselor) Haresuke KAJUJI.
His mother was the daughter of Dainagon (Major Counselor) Haresuke KAJUJI.
His mother was the daughter of Gon Dainagon Haresuke KAJUJI.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 子に参議正親町三条公高、参議正親町三条実昭。
sen.e: He had children Sangi (councillor) Kintaka OGIMACHISANJO and Sangi Saneaki SHOGIMACHI-SANJO.
His children were Sangi (councillor) Kintaka OGIMACHISANJO and Sangi Saneaki SHOGIMACHI-SANJO.
His children were Sangi (councilor) Kintaka OGIMACHISANJO and Sangi Saneaki SHOGIMACHI-SANJO.

sen.j: 娘に権大納言日野弘資の室がいる。
sen.e: He had a daughter who was the wife of Dainagon Hirosuke HINO.
He had a daughter who was the wife of Dainagon Hirosuke HINO.
He had a daughter who was the wife of Gon Dainagon Hirosuke HINO.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.e: His original name was Sanesuke.
His original name was Sanesuke.
His original name was Sanesuke.
He was ennobled in 1594.
He was ennobled in 1594.
He was ennobled in 1594.

sen.j: その後、侍従・右近衛少将・阿波権介・右近衛中将・蔵人頭をへて、慶長17年（1612年）に参議となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: After that, he became jiju (a chamberlain), Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Awa Province, Konoefu, and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and finally became Sangi in 1612 to rank with Kugyo.

After that, he became jiju (chamberlain), Konoefu (Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Awa Province, Konoefu, and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and finally became Sangi in 1612 to rank with Kugyo.

After that, he became jiju (chamberlain), Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Awa no Gon no suke (Provisional Assistant Governor of Awa Province), Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and finally became Sangi in 1612 to rank with Kugyo.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: その後、権中納言・踏歌節会外弁をへて、寛永3年（1626年）に権大納言に任じられた。
sen.e: After that, he became Chunagon and Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)) and was finally assigned to Dainagon.
After that, he became Chunagon and Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie - Imperial Court Ceremonies) and was finally assigned to Dainagon.

After that, he became Gon Chunagon and Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie - Imperial Court Ceremonies) and was finally assigned to Gon Dainagon.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 寛永5年（1628年）に太宰権帥に任官した。
sen.e: He was assigned to Dazai-no-sotsu (Director of Dazaifu (Kyushu branch government)) in 1628.
He was assigned as Dazai-no-sotsu (Director of Dazaifu - Kyushu branch government) in 1628.
He was assigned as Dazai no gon no sochi (Provisional Director of Dazaifu (Kyushu branch government)) in 1628.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。
